title: How to Make a Cardboard Rubber Band Gun

steps.headline: Gather the materials listed in the Things You'll Need section below.
Measure out an 8 x 12 inch rectangle on the cardboard.
On the eight inch side of the rectangle carefully put dots every two inches of cardboard.
steps.description: The measurements do not have to be exact.

steps.headline: Hook an old-fashioned clothespin to the end of the barrel or bore a hole through the edge of the paper and stick in a pencil.
steps.description: This is where you will hook the rubber band for firing.

steps.headline: Fold the cardboard into fourths, making a rectangular prism and folding the cardboard on the dots.
steps.description: The cardboard should now measure into four 2 x 12 inch sections.

steps.headline: Cut a strip of masking tape that is approximately 12 inches (30.5 cm) long.
steps.description: Connect the two 12 inch (30.5 cm) ends of the cardboard. You now have built the body of the gun.

steps.headline: Tape the clip securely to the barrel as shown.
Hook an old-fashioned clothespin to the end of the barrel or bore a hole through the edge of the paper and stick in a pencil.
steps.description: This is where you will hook the rubber band for firing.

steps.headline: Open the clip and hook on a rubber band.
steps.description: Now stretch the rubber band and hook it over the old-fashioned clothespin or pencil.

steps.headline: Fire away!
steps.description: Aim at a target non-living and open the clip.

text: Gather the materials listed in the Things You'll Need section below.  Measure out an 8 x 12 inch rectangle on the cardboard. Cut out the rectangle. On the eight inch side of the rectangle carefully put dots every two inches of cardboard. The measurements do not have to be exact. Hook an old-fashioned clothespin to the end of the barrel or bore a hole through the edge of the paper and stick in a pencil. This is where you will hook the rubber band for firing. Fold the cardboard into fourths, making a rectangular prism and folding the cardboard on the dots. The cardboard should now measure into four 2 x 12 inch sections. Cut a strip of masking tape that is approximately 12 inches (30.5 cm) long. Connect the two 12 inch (30.5 cm) ends of the cardboard. You now have built the body of the gun. Tape the clip securely to the barrel as shown.  Hook an old-fashioned clothespin to the end of the barrel or bore a hole through the edge of the paper and stick in a pencil. This is where you will hook the rubber band for firing. Open the clip and hook on a rubber band. Now stretch the rubber band and hook it over the old-fashioned clothespin or pencil. Fire away! Aim at a target non-living and open the clip.
sentences: Gather the materials listed in the Things You'll Need section below.
Measure out an 8 x 12 inch rectangle on the cardboard.
On the eight inch side of the rectangle carefully put dots every two inches of cardboard.
The measurements do not have to be exact.
Hook an old-fashioned clothespin to the end of the barrel or bore a hole through the edge of the paper and stick in a pencil.
This is where you will hook the rubber band for firing.
Fold the cardboard into fourths, making a rectangular prism and folding the cardboard on the dots.
The cardboard should now measure into four 2 x 12 inch sections.
Cut a strip of masking tape that is approximately 12 inches (30.5 cm) long.
Connect the two 12 inch (30.5 cm) ends of the cardboard.
You now have built the body of the gun.
Tape the clip securely to the barrel as shown.
Hook an old-fashioned clothespin to the end of the barrel or bore a hole through the edge of the paper and stick in a pencil.
This is where you will hook the rubber band for firing.
Open the clip and hook on a rubber band.
Now stretch the rubber band and hook it over the old-fashioned clothespin or pencil.
Aim at a target non-living and open the clip.
tyn_section: 1 old fashioned clothespin (the type without a metal fulcrum) OR a pencil.
a metal fulcrum) OR a large black paper clip.
Large sheet of very thick cardboard.
